Stephen T. Logan to Abraham Lincoln, 30 January 18491 Our old friendJ. H Morrisoninforms me he is about visitingWashington Cityas an applicant for the office of Surveyor General inCalifornia. You know Capt Morrison as well as I do for an old and staunchWhigand should you feel willing to assist him in getting the office I do not doubt it

will be satisfactory to our friends in this region

footnotes.text: 1Stephen T. Logan wrote this letter in its entirety.

2On March 11, 1849, Abraham Lincoln wrote letters to Secretary of WarGeorge W. Crawford, Secretary of StateJohn M. Clayton, and others on Morrison’s behalf.  Morrison apparently traveled to Washington, DC,
                  to press his claim, but in aletterto Lincoln on March 13, he thanked Lincoln for his assistance, and requested his
                  name be withdrawn from further consideration for a government position.  In June 1849,
                  however, Morrisonwroteagain asking Lincoln for help in getting the surveyor generalship of California or,
                  failing that, a clerk position in Washington.  Morrison’s name does not appear in
                  the official registers of the officers and agents of the government for 1849, 1851,
                  and 1853, so apparently he did not receive an appointment.Register of all Officers and Agents, Civil, Military, and Naval, in the Service of
